alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Marion; Morrow; Wyandot (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 1:29PM EDT until August 12 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Marion County in north central Ohio... Southeastern Wyandot County in northwestern Ohio... Northern Morrow County in north central Ohio... Southern Crawford County in north central Ohio... * Until 215 PM EDT. * At 129 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Morral, or near Marion, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Marion, Bucyrus, Galion, Crestline, Morral, Nevada, Caledonia, North Robinson, Iberia and Shauck. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for north central and northwestern Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for north central and northwestern Ohio.
